metadata.title: CVE-2013-2221 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the ZRtp::storeMsgTemp function in GNUZRTPCPP before 3.2.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a large packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2221` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libzrtpcpp2 - 2.3.4-1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libzrtpcpp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.3.4-1.1').
